# Problem Description:

There is a Chinese poem, the “Millimoniera”, with 87 lines. We say that a line divides the poem into two parts if it is preceded by a horizontal line, and a poem needs to ensure that after every horizontal line, showing it by an equality, there is also a horizontal line, showing it by an inequality.
For example, if a word at the end of one of the last lines happen near an inequality, then we cannot show the inequality.
The first patkey is the number of lines in the poem, the second one is the string of all its words concatenated into a single string and it will not contain the equalities or inequalities.
The challenge is to write a function that given a line index, returns the line’s first and last characters. You must use a dynamic programming algorithm: you must increment the state’s result to index i + 1 if i was used already i. Because of the divergent ability of the poems, you need to check the convergence for cycles.
